title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis
Interview Descriptions: There was one in person interview that lasted about 45 minutes. The two people in charge of the department interview me. Before and after the interview we communicated through email.
Interview Questions: They asked typical interview questions like describe a time that you had a disagreement or your strength and weaknesses

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis
Interview Descriptions: It was a 20 minute long phone call. Not just informational but jumped into real interview questions. Some behavioral (Tell me about a time...) some just prompting to talk about previous type of work.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when a project went well, and how did you know?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis
Interview Descriptions: It was a two interview process after phone conversation. The final interview was a panel interview with 5 people which was a little intimidating but overall a pretty good experience. Nice staff.
Interview Questions: Lots of questions about prioritozing tasks, including an exercise to complete.

title: Business Support Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then contacted by hiring manager three weeks after. Spoke for about 15mintues to review my interest in the position and job description. Scheduled interview right then and there and met with hiring team two days later.
Interview Questions: Describe three strengths and weakness.

title: Global Learning Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Their initial interview is a 30 minute virtual interview. This was honestly one of the worst interviews I have experienced in terms of how the people interviewing conducted themselves. They did not ask me to "tell them about myself" and just jumped straight into some deep interview questions. They also made me feel as if they did not have time for me/ was an inconvenience to interview me. My feelings towards being treated this way definitely played a role in my confidence during the interview.
Interview Questions: How does this role fit into your long term goals

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Completed a phone interview, few weeks later did an in-person presentation to the team then completed a Q&A after the presentation. 

It was not difficult, as I was prepared to present and motivated.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the team?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is casual, but informative at the College of Nursing. It is a lot of the typical interview questions, ie. talk about your experience, what is your major, etc.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have that would help you here? Personal or Professional

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the UMSL's website. The Interview was with a few of the staff members. It was not stressful, but be ready to answer situational questions and have some ideas about programming and residents.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy. I came into the office and met with my two direct bosses. We chatted for a while which helped make it a comfortable environment. The questions were easy and they were very nice to work with.
Interview Questions: What past experience do you have and how do you think it will help you in this position specifically.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Initial Interview- Situational/Behavioral questions with whole department. Interview consisted of 6 people asking question. A little nerve wrecking but everyone was friendly. Was called back for second interview where I was asked to present on the department and a program initiative that I could bring to the department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had to work with a difficult student.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal, more of a conversational tone. The offer letter took a little while to come. It was a panel based interview, theory questions were asked, student development, commitment to student success, etc. situational questions, transferable skills.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Higher Education?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Took a couple of weeks and several different people.  They were mostly curious about prior teaching experience, not so much about prior life experience.  It struck me that they were so much about academia and not so much about real world
Interview Questions: Previous experience and knowledge of the subject

title: Web Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis
Interview Descriptions: Received an Email for a interview on campus. No phone interview, which I prefer. Offices seemed very nice and improving. Met with Vice Chancellor and CMO. They were very pleasant to speak with. Seems like a very nice place to work for someone with 3-5 years experience. Very nice campus and location as well.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background and my desire to work for UMSL.

title: Computer Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked questions based off my resume and my comfortability within the position as an assistant. The questions were easy to answer. The interviewer was very kind which helped me not to be as nervous during the interview. The interview process was a little bit longer than normal. This was because after answering some of the interviewer's questions we talked about other topics of interested centered around the company.
Interview Questions: When was there a time that you showed leadership? How would you rate your experience with various computer software? How do you feel about assisting instructors and students during classes? How would you handle a conflict with a coworker?

title: Student Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: You get an email to set up a phone interview first. During that interview they do a conference call with 2 or 3 other people who go around and ask you question. If they like you then they'll email you and ask you to come in for an in person. During this interview there are 3-4 interviewers. The boss starts with an introduction of their position and the office. Then everyone else goes around and introduce themselves and their position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Practicum Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: An application, cover letter, and resume were required before being accepted for an interview.  One day was set aside for all interested practicum students.  We were briefed on the agency as a group and allowed to ask questions.  Then we met with several pairs of current employees and were asked a handful of questions before being interviewed by two of the main clinical supervisors of the agency.
Interview Questions: What would you say if a parent asked you if you had children?

title: Office Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis
Interview Descriptions: There was one in-person interview.  Be careful that you know what jobs you've applied for, as they used a different title when they called and in the interview.  UMSL seems to use a standard posting for similar positions.  They called me after about a week and scheduled the interview for the following week.  The interview was only about 30 minutes and was conducted with a panel of two.  They called me back the next morning to offer me the job.
Interview Questions: Describe your customer service philosophy; why did you choose this department.  Most questions were standard behavioral situations.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was sent to an office in the back of another office, the man interviewing me asked very basic interview questions and things about the classes I could teach and my gpa
Interview Questions: what classes do you think you could tutor

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick easy interview.  I came in and asked if they were hiring.  A few weeks later, the head of the tutoring department caught up with me on campus, asked my availability, and hired me on the spot.  I started the next day.  As long as you meet the minimum requirements (have earned at least a B in all math classes up to and including calc III) you should be ok.  They're usually looking for tutors.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with statistics?

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about one month after applying online through their HR system. The hiring manager (director of the department) called me to see if I was still interested and to set up a time to meet. He then emailed me to confirm the interview and gave parking details, etc. Once the day came, I met with the Director for about half an hour, where he basically read from a list of generic questions, and then I met with a committee of other people in the dept as well as an HR person. The committee went in a circle and read generic questions from a list that they all had. It was a pretty easy and straightforward interview process, and they were impressed by the questions I had for them.
Interview Questions: Really most of the questions were canned, generic interview questions. I guess the question I struggled the most with was "What is your customer service philosophy?"

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I met with the direct supervisor (department head) in person first, and then met in person with the person who would be my direct co-worker for the second part of the interview. We discussed the position and how my background, university experience, and personal skills could contribute to my success in the position I was applying for. Overall, it was a pleasant experience, non-threatening, and not too intense.
Interview Questions: How does your experience help you succeed in this position? What can you bring to the position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Missouri St Louis (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Sent application and had an interview within a month. Met faculty and had an offer within two weeks. Pretty simple.
Interview Questions: There wasn't anything really difficult. Just asked about my experiences.
